alert.note: Alert for Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 5:20PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Eagle and northeastern Pitkin Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 520 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Snowmass, or 25 miles southeast of Glenwood Springs, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Eagle and northeastern Pitkin Counties, including the following locations... Meridith. This includes Colorado 82 between mile markers 27 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys
